head.title: A Mother's Legacy; How Traffic Lights Can Fight Global Warming

hedline.hl1: A Mother's Legacy; How Traffic Lights Can Fight Global Warming

abstract.p: Sara Sheppard-Landis letter on September 15 article praises community activists for their work in having traffic lights installed in Stuyvesant Town and Peter Cooper Village

block.p: Your article gives hope for the more than 700 other spots around the city that need traffic lights.

Last spring, Peter Cooper Village and Stuyvesant Town got approval for the same glow that grows in Brooklyn. A group that included our Assemblyman, Steven Sanders and several thousand community activists persuaded the transportation commissioner, Iris Weinshall, to instruct her Manhattan commissioner, Margaret Forgione, to take a walking tour of critical crossings on Avenue C from 14th to 23rd Streets.

Last spring, Peter Cooper Village and Stuyvesant Town got approval for the same glow that grows in Brooklyn. A group that included our Assemblyman, Steven Sanders and several thousand community activists persuaded the transportation commissioner, Iris Weinshall, to instruct her Manhattan commissioner, Margaret Forgione, to take a walking tour of critical crossings on Avenue C from 14th to 23rd Streets.
As a result, all intersections are programmed to allow safe passage for park users and playground toddlers. We get our red and green lights at 16th and Avenue C for Christmas.
